rCNV 1.0.0

    Detect duplicates from SNPs

    dupGet.Rd

    Detect duplicated snps using excess of heterozygotes (alleles that do not follow HWE) and snp deviates (alleles that do not follow a normal/chi-square distribution). See details.

    Usage

    dupGet(
  data,
  test = c("z.het", "z.05", "z.all", "chi.het", "chi.05", "chi.all"),
  intersection = FALSE,
  method = c("fisher", "chi.sq"),
  plot = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    data frame of the output of allele.info()

    test

    character. type of test to be used for significance. See detials

    intersection

    logical, whether to use the intersection of the methods specified in test (if more than one)

    method

    character. method for testing excess of heterozygotes. Fisher exact test ("fisher") or Chi squre test ("chi.sq")

    plot

    logical. whether to plot the detected singletons and duplicates on allele ratio vs. proportion of heterozygotes plot.

    verbose

    logical. show progress

    ...

    additional parameters to be passed on to plot

    Value

    Returs a data frame of snps/alles with their duplication status

    Details

    to be added

    Author

    Piyal Karunarathne

    Examples

    if (FALSE) data(alleleINF)
DD<-dupGet(alleleINF)
#> assessing excess of heterozygotes
#>
